contents.item: Love is a fire. But whether it is going to warm your hearth or burn down your house, you can never tell.
You are the answer to every prayer I've offered. You are a song, a dream, a whisper, and I don't know how I could have lived without you for as long as I have.
I can feel Peeta press his forehead into my temple and he asks, 'So now that you've got me, what are you going to do with me?' I turn into him. 'Put you somewhere you can't get hurt.
Love doesn't just sit there, like a stone, it has to be made, like bread; remade all the time, made new.
contents.owner: Ursula K. Le Guin, The Lathe of Heaven

contents.item: If you like her, if she makes you happy, and if you feel like you know her---then don't let her go.
contents.owner: Nicholas Sparks, Message in a Bottle

contents.item: Be careful of love. It'll twist your brain around and leave you thinking up is down and right is wrong.
contents.owner: Rick Riordan, The Battle of the Labyrinth

contents.item: I love you more than there are stars in the sky and fish in the sea.
When love is not madness it is not love.
Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up.
I cannot fix on the hour, or the spot, or the look or the words, which laid the foundation. It is too long ago. I was in the middle before I knew that I had begun.
True love is rare, and it's the only thing that gives life real meaning.
contents.owner: Nicholas Sparks, Message in a Bottle

contents.item: Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired.

I love you also means I love you more than anyone loves you, or has loved you, or will love you, and also, I love you in a way that no one loves you, or has loved you, or will love you, and also, I love you in a way that I love no one else, and never have loved anyone else, and never will love anyone else.
It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them.
The greater the love, the greater the tragedy when it's over.
I loved her against reason, against promise, against peace, against hope, against happiness, against all discouragement that could be.

I fell in love with her courage, her sincerity, and her flaming self respect. And it's these things I'd believe in, even if the whole world indulged in wild suspicions that she wasn't all she should be. I love her and it is the beginning of everything.
You know, when it works, love is pretty amazing. It's not overrated. There's a reason for all those songs.
What Is Love? I have met in the streets a very poor young man who was in love. His hat was old, his coat worn, the water passed through his shoes and the stars through his soul

It isn't possible to love and part. You will wish that it was. You can transmute love, ignore it, muddle it, but you can never pull it out of you. I know by experience that the poets are right: love is eternal.
contents.owner: E.M. Forster, A Room with a View
